snippet: After the killing of five of their colleagues in Dallas amid protests over the latest fatal police shootings caught on video, officers in New York and elsewhere reflected on what their job is like now....
abstract: Police officers in New York City and elsewhere react to killing of five officers in Dallas amid protests against police violence following latest fatal police shootings; reflect upon unprecedented chasm growing between citizens and law enforcement officials and how their job has changed in 2016.

byline.original: By MICHAEL WILSON and MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ
byline.contributor: Jennifer Medina, Richard Oppel Jr. and Megan Jula contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: After the killing of five of their colleagues in Dallas amid protests over the latest fatal police shootings caught on video, officers in New York and elsewhere reflected on what their job is like now.

headline.main: In Week of Emotional Swings, Police Face a Dual Role: Villain and Victim
headline.print_headline: Officers Confront Dual Role: Villain and Victim

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dallas, Tex, Shooting of Police Officers (2016)
